fields.description: Trying to look up plugins by their full name doesn't seem to always work. Two examples: "JIRA Data Generator" and "JIRA Gantt-Chart Plugin" (the latter only tried because it shows up for some odd reason when I search for "data generator"). See screenshots.
fields.summary: The search in the "plugins" section doesn't match exact plugin names

fields.description:
# Create a new workflow and edit with designer.
# Add a "Closed" step. 
# Add a transition between "Open" and "Closed" called "DeleteMe".
# Reload the page.
# Add delete the transition. 
# (BUG) Add a transition between "Open" and "Closed" called "DeleteMe". Note that you are unable to do do because the designer seems to think that "DeleteMe" currently exists.
fields.summary: Workflow designer gives a "Transition with that name already Exists" when trying to use the name of a transition that I just deleted

fields.description:
In JIRA it should not be possible to create a transition of the same name between two steps. You can do it using the workflow designer:

# Create an EMPTY workflow.
# Add a Closed.
# Add A transition between "Open" and "Closed" called "New".
# (BUG) Click on the background and hit "ESC". Note that the transition has disappeared. 
# (BUG) Add a transitions between "Open" and "Closed" called "New". 

If you reload the workflow you find out that you now have two transitions called "New" between "Open" and "Closed".

There are two problems here:

# That hitting escape removes the transition.
# The server is not validating the addition of the transition.
fields.summary: Able to create transitions of the same name between the two same steps using WD

fields.description:
# Create a draft workflow.
# Open another window on the draft. 
# Delete the draft in the second window.
# (BUG) In the first window delete the draft. It looks like you successfully deleted the draft, the UI even has a message saying it was deleted.

We should be giving the user some indication that the draft was already deleted.
fields.summary: Discarding an already discarded draft does not give an error

fields.description:
# Create a draft workflow.
# Open another window on the draft. 
# Publish to draft in the second window.
# (BUG) In the first window publish the draft. You end up with:

!error.png!

We should be giving a nicer error message.
fields.summary: Trying to publish a draft that is already published displays a bad error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28349].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in custom field descriptions. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all].

We would like to come up with a secure compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the custom field descriptions for. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using custom field descriptions by asking you to comment on this issue.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand custom field descriptions
Workflow editor mangles layout after saving/publishing
Detect lack of index permissions in DB connection

Share feature should make an entry in the issue trail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28344].
  {panel}

Essential features like managing versions of a project are inaccessible with browsers, who have their local dom storage disabled for security reasons.

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Open Firefox and navigate to "about:config" 
- Filter for {{dom.storage.enabled}} and set it to {{false}} by double-clicking the entry 
- Open JIRA and try to manage project versions or updating your Avatar image. \\ Certainly many more functions are affected as well

h3. Error
- Instead of displaying the screen to manage your versions the UI only presents the "Please wait indicator" overlay.
- The JavaScript console display the following entry {code}
localStorage is null
https://www.exxcellent.de/jira/s/en_UKw6luo9/731/6/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js
Line 389
{code}
- The UI is fully blocked by the "please wait" overlay and no longer usable 

h3. Desired resolution
JIRA must not blindly assume, that the local DOM storage is available. 
HTML5 features like these may be inaccessible due to a variety of security/browser/other limitations.
fields.summary: Support running in browsers with local DOM storage disabled

fields.description:
Hello,
after updating from Jira 4.4.5 to 5.0.5 it is not possible to update the Universal Plugin Manager (UPM) via the prompt for update under "Manage My Plugins" in the administration interface. When clicking on the link "Update now!" nothing is happening. It looks like the Browser doesn't even try to load anything, so it's maybe AJAX related? We've tried IE9 and Firefox 7.0.1

We recently updated our test environment from 4.4.5 to 5.0.4 (5.0.5 wasn't available then). It's nearly exactly the same setup(except from the data within it). There this link to update the UPM works in IE9 without the problem.



Thank you very much!

Br,
Manuel
fields.summary: Not possible to update UPM over the "Update now!" link under "Manage My Plugins" in Jira 5.0.5
Allow multiple owners for a dashboard

As deriving from support issues, perhaps there is the need to document a few things about how Lucene works, what the stopwords list is, etc.

Furthermore, a few things could be added in order to answer why if you search for "log jira" you also get results about "logging jira" and so on.

Please consider it and feel free to get back to me should any details be needed.

Thank you in advance.
fields.summary: Create a documentation about lucene stopwords list
Review search examples

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28339].
  {panel}

Ability to create a number of filters in Jira.
For example:
All open ticket were I or one of my team members are BPO.
All open ticket were I or one of my team members are BPM.
All open tickets within a certain Process Area, such as Inventory Management.
All open tickets within a certain Component, such as Distribution.

Today it is extremely difficult to create these kind of filter's which are required for monitoring and follow-up. Instead personal excel tables are maintained on local PC's in order to review open tickets.
fields.summary: Improve Jira task filtering for Sandvik users

fields.description:
A workflow scheme that uses a "bad workflow" (contains Status ID error introuduced via XML import) cannot be unhooked from a project.    The "Actions Cog" is missing from the workflow tab so it's not possible to switch to a different scheme and undo the damage.

The bad workflow cannot be deleted because it is active.
The workflow scheme cannot be edited or deleted because it is active.

There are three fixes, all rather extreme:
# Roll back: restore JIRA from back-up
# Make changes to the JIRA database to edit the Status ID
# Delete the project & then re-import the XML workflow after fixing the Status ID there.

I believe that it's a defect that there is no way to switch to a different workflow scheme.

h3. Background:


An XML workflow that has been massaged to contain good "fieldscreen.id" can be imported into JIRA without generating an exception on import.

However,  if the XML contains an invalid "status.id" then the import will appear to succeed without problems.

If the workflow is then associated with a workflow scheme and that scheme associated with a project then an exception will display on-screen when viewing the workflow tab for the project admin:

{noformat}
Error rendering WebPanel (workflows/workflows.vm): org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in class com.atlassian.jira.web.component.IssueConstantWebComponent threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at workflows/workflows.vm[line 136, column 65]
{noformat}

From atlassian-jira.log:

{noformat}
2012-05-11 14:01:18,815 http-8080-13 WARN marks 841x388766x1 17d4esl 192.168.150.57 /plugins/servlet/project-config/TST/workflows [plugin.web.model.ResourceTemplateWebPanel] Error rendering WebPanel (workflows/workflows.vm): org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in  class com.atlassian.jira.web.component.IssueConstantWebComponent threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at workflows/workflows.vm[line 136, column 65]
com.atlassian.templaterenderer.RenderingException: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in  class com.atlassian.jira.web.component.IssueConstantWebComponent threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at workflows/workflows.vm[line 136, column 65]
	at com.atlassian.templaterenderer.velocity.one.six.internal.VelocityTemplateRendererImpl.render(VelocityTemplateRendererImpl.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.templaterenderer.AbstractVelocityWebPanelRenderer.render(AbstractVelocityWebPanelRenderer.java:33)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.web.model.ResourceTemplateWebPanel.getHtml(ResourceTemplateWebPanel.java:47)
(snip..see attached log)
{noformat}

h3. Note Also:
There might be two other issues here..

# The XML import should check Status ID
# Integrity Checker should check Status ID.  This is what it gives currently when there is a workflow with a broken Status ID:

Check Workflow Integrity 
PASSED: Check workflow entry states are correct 
PASSED: Check workflow current step entries 
PASSED: Check JIRA issues with null status
fields.summary: Workflow Scheme with Bad Workflow Cannot be Disassociated from Project

fields.description:
1) Sometimes the filter allows to send emails to email addresses even though that user isn't created in the JIRA instance. On the other hand, it is not allowed to send to that same user.

2) Most of the mails sent via the Share Button, contains a link to and empty issue search query - which then doesn't make sense.

In a nutshell, it does sometimes allow to send shares to non-JIRA users. Other times only JIRA users. The inconsistency causes confusion to the JIRA users.

Perhaps the developers can come up with a fix to this or even a global feature to disable the Share button.
fields.summary: Inconsistency of the Share Button feature in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28334].
  {panel}

Currently SSL and Proxy are two of the more difficult configurations to setup on JIRA. It would be great to reduce the difficulty of this by enhancing the JIRA Configuration Tool so that it handles the setup of these. Already we have a fairly large amount of documentation that could be reduced with this functionality built in, for example:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Apache+Reverse+Proxy+Using+the+AJP+Protocol
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+IIS

And looking at the number of KBs we have to cater for these:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/label/JIRAKB/ssl -> 12
http://confluence.atlassian.com/label/JIRAKB/apache -> 20
http://confluence.atlassian.com/label/JIRAKB/iis -> 3

For example, you could add a SSL and a Proxy tab to the configuration tool, or put them all in the Web Server tab, wherever fits best. This would then allow something like the following for SSL:

# Select the SSL tab.
# Select the location of the certificate.
# Enter the certificate alias, if applicable.
# Select the desired keystore (cacerts/user specific).
# Enter the HTTPS port.
# Select whether or not you wish to force HTTPS.
# Hit the apply button.

This would then execute the appropriate keytool command to import the certificate using the path provided, update the {{server.xml}} and also modify the {{WEB-INF/web.xml}} if they want to force HTTPS.It could also provide an appropriate description of any errors if they arise.

For proxy, something like this would be ideal:

# Select the proxy tab.
# Select the proxy type (mod_proxy or AJP).
# Enter the HTTPS port.
# Enter the AJP port (if applicable).
# Select whether or not HTTPS is being offloaded at the reverse-proxy.
# Enter the base URL.
# Enter the JIRA server IP.
# Hit Apply.

This would then:

# Parse the base URL and determine if a {{context}} path needs to be set in {{server.xml}} (as in [Configure JIRA's application server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache#IntegratingJIRAwithApache-Step1ConfigureJIRAsapplicationserver]).
# Add the {{proxyPort}}, {{scheme}} and {{proxyPath}} attributes to the connector in {{server.xml}} (these values will vary depending on the settings, as in [Alternative configuration if HTTPS is terminated on the proxy server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL#IntegratingJIRAwithApacheusingSSL-NoteAlternativeconfigurationifHTTPSisterminatedontheproxyserver] and [Troubleshooting|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache#IntegratingJIRAwithApache-Troubleshooting].
# If you want to be super awesome, generate the block of text that the user will need to copy/paste into their VirtualHost configuration. For example:
{code:title=VirtualHost}

<Proxy *>
Order deny,allow
Allow from all
</Proxy>

ProxyRequests       	Off
ProxyPreserveHost 	On

SSLEngine		On <-- based on whether or not terminating SSL

ProxyPass 		/${context_path}	[ajp|http|https]://${JIRA IP}:${ajp or JIRA port}/${context_path}
ProxyPassReverse 	/${context_path}	[ajp|http|https]://${JIRA IP}:${ajp or JIRA port}/${context_path}
{code}

This would be *incredibly* useful.
fields.summary: Enhance the JIRA Configuration Tool so that it can handle the setup of SSL and proxies

fields.description:
For a project, I've made labels hidden in the field configuration.

However, when I go to More Actions->Labels I can still add labels. Yet, the labels obviously do not show and nothing can be done.

This is confusing for many users.

When labels are hidden can the action menu also hide the ability to create labels?
fields.summary: Being able to add labels although labels are disabled

fields.description:
* Configure Zendesk Cloud Connector on JIRA OnDemand instance (5.1).

* Link a JIRA issue to a Zendesk ticket.

* Every issue action starts taking longer time. 

The reason seem to be the issue and ticket synching.

Statistics

Issue action that was analysed in different scenarios: ??Change assignee through Assignee dialog??

*JIRA OnDemand (JIRA - 5.0.4)*
*Cloud Connectors: CustomWare Zendesk Connector Plugin 2.1*

Type of issue: An issue that is linked to a Zendesk ticket
Time taken for the page reload: between 12 - 15 seconds
!nw_time_pagereload1.png!

Type of issue: An issue that is NOT linked to a Zendesk ticket
Time taken for the page reload: between ~5 seconds
!nw_time_pagereload2.png!

*JIRA OnDemand (JIRA - 5.1)*
*Cloud Connectors: CustomWare Zendesk Connector Plugin 2.1*
*KA Disabled*

Type of issue: An issue that is linked to a Zendesk ticket
Time taken for the page reload: between 22 - 25 seconds
!5.1_nw_time_pagereload1.png!

Type of issue: An issue that is NOT linked to a Zendesk ticket
Time taken for the page reload: between ~5 seconds
!5.1_nw_time_pagereload2.png!

*JIRA OnDemand (JIRA - 5.1)*
*Cloud Connectors: CustomWare Zendesk Connector Plugin 2.1*
*KA Enabled: 1.0.23*

Type of issue: An issue that is linked to a Zendesk ticket
Time taken for the page reload: between 30 - 35 seconds
!51ka_nw_time_pagereload1.png!

Type of issue: An issue that is NOT linked to a Zendesk ticket
Time taken for the page reload: few milliseconds
!51ka_nw_time_pagereload2.png!


This delay becomes very obvious when Kick Ass is enabled, because, the issue action dialog remains on the page for a longer period of time, because KA has got rid of whole page reload.
fields.summary: Cloud Connectors considerably delay the view issue page update on performing an issue action
Please upgrade Gliffy plugin to 3.8-RC1 on 5.1
Please upgrade Balsamiq to 2.1.16 on JIRA 5.1
Please upgrade JSU plugin to 1.3.0 on 5.1
Please upgrade Tempo plugin to 7.2 on 5.0.6

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28318].
  {panel}

The validation of the email address is not considering the [RFC 2822|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2822], which allow to use white space on mail address (local-part) between quotes.
Here is a related [issue|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-126908].

Kindly regards,

Paulo Renato
Atlassian support
fields.summary: Unable to use white space in email address

Share auto complete only to show users with browse access to that project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28314].
  {panel}

Currently, the bulk edit feature displays default fields and doesn't align with the screens or fields that have been setup for the instance. 

Consequently, there are fields being displayed on bulk edit that are not accessible to edit or view when working with the issue.  This can lead to both confusion as well as orphaned data -- user modifies a field during bulk edit that they will never be able to view or change. 

Either provide the ability to configure fields by project that are only available for bulk editing or allow the screens configuration to drive what the user can bulk edit. 

We definitely need it by project since our projects are very different and have very different screen schemes since we use Jira throughout our development, sales, support, and implementation depts.
fields.summary: Configure bulk edit options to avoid confusion

1. View the People tab of a Project. Pick one where no Project Roles has been assigned to the users yet.
2. Click on one of the Roles field to add users, Press Esc. 

On IE9, Cursor jumps out of the table to outside, and the field can not be clicked again.
Video Capture: http://screencast.com/t/KdroZHZqqkwR

On IE8, Field becomes un-usable for a while. Clicking on field does nothing for around 10 seconds, after which it regains itself.

fields.summary: Wrong version of Jira in Upgrade Notice
Option to be automatically added as a watcher if I interact with an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28305].
  {panel}

If I create a story, but don't assign an epic to it, then I create a few sub-tasks, then I assign an epic to only the story, the sub-tasks won't have the epic assigned. 

Because the view of an epic with all of its stories and tasks only shows the ones with the epic assigned, and - here's the real problem - the estimates that roll up to the epic don't include the unaffiliated tasks.

(1) Ideally, when assigning an epic theme to a story, I have the option to cascade it to the children of that story.
(2) When adding new tasks to a story with an epic theme, it would be nice if they would auto-adopt the story's epic theme.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the option of bulk applying an epic theme to all child elements and their children in order to have correct aggregated data at the epic level
Redirect from searchrequest.html page to login screen

fields.description:
For one of our Jira projects, users are consistently receiving two email notifications of each event. One email is HTML formatted. The other is text. The content is similar but not identical. (The text email includes a copy of the description of the issue, but The HTML email does not). 

I have attached a screenshot of both emails (with some identifying information obscured to maintain privacy).

What could cause two separate email notifications to be sent for the same event? Is this a bug? Could it be a configuration setting?

This problem does not occur on a separate Jira project which is using the same notification scheme. 


Thanks,

Mike
fields.summary: Multiple Email Notifications for the Same Event

fields.description:
There seems to be a problem displaying the summary if a query is using a field which uses a customfield which is a "Select List" which uses a Search template of "multi select searcher"

In this configuration, the summary will display the field but not show the values which were searched for.

This is easily reproduced with a fresh install of JIRA with no custom plugins or modifications:

1. create a new custom field of type "select List" 
2. Name of field is inconsequential and does not factor into the bug, any value will do
3. choose search template : Multi Key Searcher
4. applicable issue types are inconsequential and do not factor into the bug, any values will do
5. applicable context is inconsequential and does not factor into the bug, any values will do
6. Screens are inconsequential and do not factor into the bug, any values will do
7. Configure this field and add at least 1 option, name of option is inconsequential.
8. navigate to issue navigator and perform a search using the new field and selecting to search for at least 1 option (other than "Any")
9. switch to Summary Tab, and the field will display, but the values used to search are not displayed.

In addition, this results in a log entry every time the summary tab is displayed with 1 of these fields:

2012-05-18 10:27:52,125 http-8080-7 WARN ***** 627x353x1 6fcn2 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa [velocity] Could not determine type of iterator in #foreach loop  at [0,0] in template templates/plugins/fields/view-searcher/view-searcher-multioption.vm
fields.summary: Single Select custom field with multi select search can not be seen in the query summary

fields.description:
This bug addresses Look and Feel behavior, which configuration acts differently between JIRA 4.4 and JIRA 5.0 whereby:
- The color scheme of JIRA 5.0 does not behave according to the configuration in the Look and Feel section. This behavior affects the following color scheme configuration:
-- Link Color
-- Link Active Color

- And also, while configuring same color scheme configuration for both JIRA 4.4 and JIRA 5.0, the configuration behaves differently between these two versions. This behavior affects the following color scheme configuration:
-- Heading Color

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
# Go to Look and Feel and set the color scheme as attached screenshot for both JIRA 4.4 and JIRA 5.0: *COLOR SET*
# Set Link color to *#411E66* and the color is not consistent to all the link in jira. Screenshot attached : *LINK COLOR*
# Set Link Active color to #346006. When a link is active it does not appear in this color. Screenshot attached : *Link Active Color*
# Set Heading Color to #900925. The color does not appear in in the header in view issue screen. Rather it appears as link color. See the difference between  Screenshot: *4.4 Heading Color* and *5.0 Heading Color*

Screenshots are attached to better clarify the behavior here.
fields.summary: Link Color, Link Active Color and Heading Color are not consistent to all appropriate sections
can you create a way to limit the amount of information displayed to a user when an unhandled exception occurs?
Option to disable concurrent logins in JIRA

fields.description:
A period of inactivity of 24 hours on a JIRA installation results in a wrong calculation and display of "yesterday" in the activity stream. Actually yesterday is then no longer yesterday, but the day of last activity in the JIRA installation.

On our DEV environment we tested a lot on Wednesday. Thursday was a bank holiday, why no one tested on JIRA DEV. Today (Friday) JIRA insists that many actions were executed yesterday, which indeed were done on Wednesday.

Please compare both screenshots:

-----

*1104.png (was made 11:04 am.)*

- Creation of DISC-1313 (marked with red 3) was done +yesterday+ 11:09 am. according to the activity stream.

-----

*1113.png (was made 11:13 am.)*

- Creation of DISC-1313 (marked with red 3) was done +Wednesday+ 11:09 am. according to the activity stream.

-----

Seems as if JIRA thinks it is still the day after the last action anyway and brings everything in sync when all actions are less than 24 hours in the past.
fields.summary: Activity stream handles inactivity wrong - wrong date is shown!

fields.description:
Creating an issue through a direct html link: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+via+direct+HTML+links] when there is a custom field enabled as *necessary* and it's not filled out it throws an _ugly_ error message. Eg:
{code}
customfield_10500: NUMBER FIELD is required.
{code}
It would be more aesthetically pleasing if the name of the field and text "is required" is there instead.

h4. To reproduce:
* Put custom field on a create issue screen and make it mandatory
* Figure out direct link (project id and issuetype)
* Go to the direct issue create link
* Don't fill out mandatory fields
* Click submit
* Observe the error messages
fields.summary: Create issues via direct HTML links show ugly messages when failing on necessary fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28292].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to any issue and with the dot dialog choose Move
# When on the move page, press and hold the back button.

Note that the title displayed in the back button is not the title of the issue you came from rather "Operations - " then the project name.
fields.summary: Title of window is incorrect when going Back to a page which had a dialog displayed
Default Attachment sort order

fields.description:
Defined a query that filters only issues in 1 project and of 1 specific issue type.

Added some columns to the issue navigator, corresponding to custom fields defined for this project and this issue type. All filtered issues have values for these custom fields.

However, when user returns to the Issue navigator search from the Configure panel, the custom fields are no longer visible. Apparently, the custom fields are not exported to Excel.

Making the context Global will solve the problem with the issue navigator and the export to excel.

However this is not the optimal solution as the Custom Fields will appear in all the projects using the same screen. Additionally, some of these custom fields have multiple context, with different values depending on the project, and each of this project should be able to perform a query and export these fields.

Kindly refer to the attachments to have a better understanding of the problem.
fields.summary: Custom Fields do not appear after returning to Issue Navigator from Configure causing custom fields not to be exported to Excel

- Install [JIRA Polish Language Pack|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugins/tac.jira.languages.pl_PL] or [JIRA Chinese Language Pack|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/tac.jira.languages.zh_CN]
- Change the language setting to Polish or Chinese via {{Administration > General Configuration}}
- Try to access the Application Link configuration screen ({{Administration > Application Links}})
- The error will be reproduced
fields.summary: Problem opening the Application Link configuration screen when we configure JIRA to use Polish language or Chinese language

  {panel}

Currently when you sort by versions in the issue navigator, JIRA only checks/sorts by the first version, see here:
!^sort version.png|thumbnail!

It'd be nice if JIRA would also consider the sub-versions when sorting.

Example for the above screenshot:
{code}
version1
version1
version1
version1, version2
version1, version2
version1, version2, version3
version1, version3
version1, version3
version2
version2, version3
version2, version3
version3
version3
{code}
fields.summary: Improve version sorting

fields.description:
Here are three JQL queries:

# The number of issues that are tagged as being fixed in the latest release: {code}
project=JRA 
AND fixVersion = latestReleasedVersion(JRA){code}  There are 53 of these.
# The number of issues that have ever been tagged as being fixed in that release: {code}
project=JRA 
AND fixVersion WAS latestReleasedVersion(JRA)
{code}  There are 71 of these.
# The number of issues that were tagged as being fixed in the latest release, but which are no longer tagged against that release {code}
project=JRA 
AND fixVersion WAS latestReleasedVersion(JRA)
AND fixVersion != latestReleasedVersion(JRA){code}  There are 13 of these.

By my math, the numbers should add up, i.e. the number of issues we fixed in the release and the number of issues we didn't fix in the release should add up to the total number of issues we intended to fix in the release.
fields.summary: Numbers don't add up for change history search by version...

fields.description:
I'm creating a new ticket as the orignal may not be fixed, or maybe it's re-occuring with the newer versions:
JRA-27607

The ticket indicates that it is fixed, but after some local testing, it seems the problem is occuring for JIRA 5.0.2 and 5.0.3
{quote}
Steps to reproduce:
# Have two projects
# Create a select list custom field
** Create multiple contexts for the 2 projects above
** the contexts can have different or same default values
# Click the create issue button and select the first project
# Switch to the second project
{quote}

Expect: the default values to be filled in
Actual: the fields with default values *now set to "None"*
fields.summary: still not fixed - Default values aren't respected when changing project in create issue popup

fields.description:
When using the *Custom Field Group Value* to set *Browse Project* permission, a user is able to view the issue, but for some reason can't use issue navigator to search for the comments.

Reproduce:
* Add *Custom Field Group Value* to a projects *Browse Project* permission
!^permissions.png|thumbnail!
* Ensure that your user is part of group that will be tested (in this case testgroup)
!^testuser group.png|thumbnail!
* Create ticket, setting *testgroup* in the Group Picker field
!^issue view.jpg|thumbnail!
** Note that the user can see the ticket and add/view comments
* Try to perform an issue navigator search for comments:
!^search fails.png|thumbnail!

If I then go back and add the *Browse Project* permission to *Group(testgroup)* directly, the user can then use the same search and return the appropriate ticket.
fields.summary: Using Custom Field Group Value for the Browse Project permission does not allow comments to be searched

  {panel}

Hi all,

I have a project called Marketing and multiple issue types; Strategy, Marketing, Planning. Depending on the issue type selected I want to be able to display a different list of values for a field called Area. So for example if Marketing is the issue type, Area would have the vlaues Market Problem, Competitive Landscape and Technology Assessment, but if the Issue type is Strategy the Aread field would have the values Market Definition, Distribution Strategy...

Regards,
Ruchi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28271].
  {panel}

Hi, we recently ran into this problem.
A user has edited his profile details, by changing "email address" field.
He entered TWO email addres separated by semicolon (e.g. "foo@bar.com; bar@foo.com").
From that moment all the notification emails to his profile where blocked in Mail Error Queue (because of the invalid email address).
I know that Jira doesn't support multiple email addresses per user, but it would be nice to tell to the user that the email addres he entered is invalid.

Thanks,
Davide.
fields.summary: Validate user email address

fields.description:
The following scenario results in a cycle being reported where there is none.  The left side is the name of the filter.  The right side is the JQL for the filter.

Common: project = TEST
Unresolved: filter = Common and resolution is empty
Resolved: filter = Common and filter != Unresolved
To produce bug, now create a new search for: filter = Resolved

This will report a cycle, even though there is clearly no cycle.

This has rendered our sophisticated set of filters inoperative and is quite frustrating.
fields.summary: JQL Cycle Detection Regression (4.4 -> 5.0)

fields.description:
If a transition is in progress for an issue and another request to update the issue occurs then the second update may rewrite the issue status to the value it had before the transition occurred.

This is happens intermittently as the result of a race condition to update the issue.

An example can be clearly seen in the changelog for GHS-4767, https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/GHS-4767?expand=changelog at time 2012-05-10T18:27:30.416-0500 .
fields.summary: Status field is corrupted by a concurrent request to update an issue while a transition is in flight

This error usually occurs when your plugin imports a package from another bundle with a specific version constraint and either the bundle providing that package doesn't meet those version constraints, or there is no bundle available that provides the specified package. fields.description:
Currently I am able to delete an issue if I have the permission "Delete Issues", even if the issue has worklogs of other users assigned to it and I dont have the permission "Delete All Worklogs".
Due to this fact, an employee without corresponding permission is able to change the worked time of other employees, by deleting issues.

Therefore the delete issue function needs to respect the permission "Delete All Worklogs".
fields.summary: JIRA does not restrict deletion of an issue if worklogs are booked to it

fields.summary: Stack trace when accessing the error page during an import

fields.description:
The JIRA installer appears to not detect modifications to server.xml

For our deployment of Jira Standalone on Linux, we have it running behind a proxy server out of a subdirectory on our domain. As such, we have a modified server.xml that changes the port, sets the proxy domain name and port, and sets the root directory.

Upgrading Jira via the installer catches other modified or unrecognized files, but does not appear to recognize changes to server.xml and, as such, we are forced to manually updated server.xml each time.

This bug also exists in the Confluence installer as well. Please let me know if it is necessary to file a bug separately for Confluence.

Thanks.
fields.summary: JIRA installer does not detect modifications to server.xml

fields.description:
Sometimes JIRA's autocomplete actively replaces the valid text I've entered with something invalid.

For example, here I'm trying to set the reporter to 'jturner'. I type 'jturner' and press enter. While I type, autocomplete matches the wrong user ('admin') and substitutes it in when I press enter:

!jiraautocomplete.mpeg!

This also bites me when linking issues. For example, in this vid I want to link to SS-53. It's not in the autocomplete drop-down but that's ok, I know it's there. So I type 'SS-53' and hit tab (quickly). Autocomplete then replaces what I entered with its first hit, SS-5. 

!autocomplete.mpeg!

The upshot of repeated exposure to this bug is that I can't trust any autocompleted field not to screw with what I've just entered.
fields.summary: Autocomplete of issues sometimes replaces what I've entered with an incorrect match

fields.description:
Custom Fields & Plugin developers have no way of preventing the submission of the quick create / edit dialogs. This means they cannot run their own client side validation.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/54239/in-jira-5-how-can-i-do-javascript-validation-on-the-quick-edit-edit-and-create-screens
fields.summary: No way to prevent submit in Quick Create / Edit
Summary highlighted when edit an issue
make JQL auto-complete slightly smarter for fixVersion
Searching for issues using the REST API, date and time fields appear to be rounding down milliseconds to 000
Turn on 'Source' and 'Reviews' only when Project App Link is created
Possibility to rename a gadget title by your own

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28234].
  {panel}

Comments are not reported in the changelog of an issue while for instance, worklogs or attachments are reported.

My application check for updates on issues via the rest API.
Right now I have to check worklogs and comments.
It would be nice to only have to retrieve the worklogs to get all updates.
fields.summary: With the REST API, comments are not reported in the changelog of an issue.
Component field in issue changelog and in issue fields are not matching
